Accommodation and Food Services_total_em.long_description: Total jobs by businesses in Accommodation and Food Services industry. The Accommodation and Food Services sector comprises establishments providing customers with lodging and/or preparing meals, snacks, and beverages for immediate consumption. The sector includes both accommodation and food services establishments because the two activities are often combined at the same establishment.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=72&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 72}.. Available for US businesses.
Accommodation and Food Services_total_em.long_name: Total Employment in Accommodation and Food Services industry

Accommodation and Food Services_total_em.short_name: Total Employment in Accommodation and Food Services

Administrative and Support and Waste Man.long_description: Total jobs by businesses in Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services industry. The Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services sector comprises establishments performing routine support activities for the day-to-day operations of other organizations. These essential activities are often undertaken in-house by establishments in many sectors of the economy.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=56&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 56}.. Available for US businesses.
Administrative and Support and Waste Man.long_name: Total Employment in Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services industry

Administrative and Support and Waste Man.short_name: Total Employment in Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services

Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunti.long_description: Total jobs by businesses in Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting industry. The Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in growing crops, raising animals, harvesting timber, and harvesting fish and other animals from a farm, ranch, or their natural habitats.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=11&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 11}.. Available for US businesses.
Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunti.long_name: Total Employment in Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting industry
Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunti.short_description: Total jobs by businesses in Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting
Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunti.short_name: Total Employment in Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting

Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation_tota.long_description: Total jobs by businesses in Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation industry. The Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation sector includes a wide range of establishments that operate facilities or provide services to meet varied cultural, entertainment, and recreational interests of their patrons.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=71&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 71}.. Available for US businesses.
Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation_tota.long_name: Total Employment in Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation industry
Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation_tota.short_description: Total jobs by businesses in Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation
Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation_tota.short_name: Total Employment in Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation

Construction_total_employment.long_description: Total jobs by businesses in Construction industry. The Construction sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in the construction of buildings or engineering projects (e.g., highways and utility systems). Establishments primarily engaged in the preparation of sites for new construction and establishments primarily engaged in subdividing land for sale as building sites also are included in this sector.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=23&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 23}.. Available for US businesses.
Construction_total_employment.short_description: Total jobs by businesses in Construction

Educational Services_total_employment.long_description: Total jobs by businesses in Educational Services industry. The Educational Services sector comprises establishments that provide instruction and training in a wide variety of subjects. This instruction and training is provided by specialized establishments, such as schools, colleges, universities, and training centers. These establishments may be privately owned and operated for profit or not for profit, or they may be publicly owned and operated. They may also offer food and/or accommodation services to their students.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=61&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 61}.. Available for US businesses.
Educational Services_total_employment.long_name: Total Employment in Educational Services industry
Educational Services_total_employment.short_description: Total jobs by businesses in Educational Services

Finance and Insurance_total_employment.long_description: Total jobs by businesses in Finance and Insurance industry. The Finance and Insurance sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in financial transactions (transactions involving the creation, liquidation, or change in ownership of financial assets) and/or in facilitating financial transactions.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=52&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 52}.. Available for US businesses.
Finance and Insurance_total_employment.long_name: Total Employment in Finance and Insurance industry
Finance and Insurance_total_employment.short_description: Total jobs by businesses in Finance and Insurance
Finance and Insurance_total_employment.short_name: Total Employment in Finance and Insurance

Health Care and Social Assistance_total_.long_description: Total jobs by businesses in Health Care and Social Assistance industry. The Health Care and Social Assistance sector comprises establishments providing health care and social assistance for individuals. The sector includes both health care and social assistance because it is sometimes difficult to distinguish between the boundaries of these two activities.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=62&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 62}.. Available for US businesses.
Health Care and Social Assistance_total_.long_name: Total Employment in Health Care and Social Assistance industry
Health Care and Social Assistance_total_.short_description: Total jobs by businesses in Health Care and Social Assistance
Health Care and Social Assistance_total_.short_name: Total Employment in Health Care and Social Assistance

Information_total_employment.long_description: Total jobs by businesses in Information industry. The Information sector comprises establishments engaged in the following processes: (a) producing and distributing information and cultural products, (b) providing the means to transmit or distribute these products as well as data or communications, and (c) processing data.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=51&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 51}.. Available for US businesses.
Information_total_employment.short_description: Total jobs by businesses in Information

Management of Companies and Enterprises_.long_description: Total jobs by businesses in Management of Companies and Enterprises industry. The Management of Companies and Enterprises sector comprises (1) establishments that hold the securities of (or other equity interests in) companies and enterprises for the purpose of owning a controlling interest or influencing management decisions or (2) establishments (except government establishments) that administer, oversee, and manage establishments of the company or enterprise and that normally undertake the strategic or organizational planning and decision-making role of the company or enterprise. Establishments that administer, oversee, and manage may hold the securities of the company or enterprise.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=55&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 55}.. Available for US businesses.
Management of Companies and Enterprises_.long_name: Total Employment in Management of Companies and Enterprises industry
Management of Companies and Enterprises_.short_description: Total jobs by businesses in Management of Companies and Enterprises
Management of Companies and Enterprises_.short_name: Total Employment in Management of Companies and Enterprises

Manufacturing_total_employment.long_description: Total jobs by businesses in Manufacturing industry. The Manufacturing sector comprises establishments engaged in the mechanical, physical, or chemical transformation of materials, substances, or components into new products. The assembling of component parts of manufactured products is considered manufacturing, except in cases where the activity is appropriately classified in Sector 23, Construction.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=31&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 31-33}.. Available for US businesses.
Manufacturing_total_employment.short_description: Total jobs by businesses in Manufacturing

Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extra.long_description: Total jobs by businesses in Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction industry. The Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction sector comprises establishments that extract naturally occurring mineral solids, such as coal and ores; liquid minerals, such as crude petroleum; and gases, such as natural gas. The term mining is used in the broad sense to include quarrying, well operations, beneficiating (e.g., crushing, screening, washing, and flotation), and other preparation customarily performed at the mine site, or as a part of mining activity.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=21&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 21}.. Available for US businesses.
Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extra.long_name: Total Employment in Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction industry

Professional, Scientific, and Technical.long_description: Total jobs by businesses in Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services industry. The Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services sector comprises establishments that specialize in performing professional, scientific, and technical activities for others. These activities require a high degree of expertise and training.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=54&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 54}.. Available for US businesses.

Public Administration_total_employment.long_description: Total jobs by businesses in Public Administration industry. The Public Administration sector consists of establishments of federal, state, and local government agencies that administer, oversee, and manage public programs and have executive, legislative, or judicial authority over other institutions within a given area.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=92&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 92}.. Available for US businesses.
Public Administration_total_employment.long_name: Total Employment in Public Administration industry
Public Administration_total_employment.short_description: Total jobs by businesses in Public Administration

Real Estate and Rental and Leasing_total.long_description: Total jobs by businesses in Real Estate and Rental and Leasing industry. The Real Estate and Rental and Leasing sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in renting, leasing, or otherwise allowing the use of tangible or intangible assets, and establishments providing related services. The major portion of this sector comprises establishments that rent, lease, or otherwise allow the use of their own assets by others.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=53&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 53}.. Available for US businesses.

Retail Trade_total_employment.long_description: Total jobs by businesses in Retail Trade industry. The Retail Trade sector comprises establishments engaged in retailing merchandise, generally without transformation, and rendering services incidental to the sale of merchandise.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=44&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 44-45}.. Available for US businesses.
Retail Trade_total_employment.long_name: Total Employment in Retail Trade industry
Retail Trade_total_employment.short_description: Total jobs by businesses in Retail Trade

Transportation and Warehousing_total_emp.long_description: Total jobs by businesses in Transportation and Warehousing industry. The Transportation and Warehousing sector includes industries providing transportation of passengers and cargo, warehousing and storage for goods, scenic and sightseeing transportation, and support activities related to modes of transportation. Establishments in these industries use transportation equipment or transportation related facilities as a productive asset. The type of equipment depends on the mode of transportation. The modes of transportation are air, rail, water, road, and pipeline.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=48&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 48-49}.. Available for US businesses.

Transportation and Warehousing_total_emp.short_name: Total Employment in Transportation and Warehousing

Utilities_total_employment.long_description: Total jobs by businesses in Utilities industry. The Utilities sector comprises establishments engaged in the provision of the following utility services: electric power, natural gas, steam supply, water supply, and sewage removal. Within this sector, the specific activities associated with the utility services provided vary by utility: electric power includes generation, transmission, and distribution; natural gas includes distribution; steam supply includes provision and/or distribution; water supply includes treatment and distribution; and sewage removal includes collection, treatment, and disposal of waste through sewer systems and sewage treatment facilities.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=22&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 22}.. Available for US businesses.
Utilities_total_employment.short_description: Total jobs by businesses in Utilities

Wholesale Trade_total_employment.long_description: Total jobs by businesses in Wholesale Trade industry. The Wholesale Trade sector comprises establishments engaged in wholesaling merchandise, generally without transformation, and rendering services incidental to the sale of merchandise. The merchandise described in this sector includes the outputs of agriculture, mining, manufacturing, and certain information industries, such as publishing.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=42&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 42}.. Available for US businesses.

Educational Services_job_creation_active.long_description: Count of new jobs created by active businesses (an active business is a company that exist last year) in Educational Services industry. The Educational Services sector comprises establishments that provide instruction and training in a wide variety of subjects. This instruction and training is provided by specialized establishments, such as schools, colleges, universities, and training centers. These establishments may be privately owned and operated for profit or not for profit, or they may be publicly owned and operated. They may also offer food and/or accommodation services to their students.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=61&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 61}.. Available for US businesses.

Management of Companies and Enterprises_.long_description: Count of new jobs created by active businesses (an active business is a company that exist last year) in Management of Companies and Enterprises industry. The Management of Companies and Enterprises sector comprises (1) establishments that hold the securities of (or other equity interests in) companies and enterprises for the purpose of owning a controlling interest or influencing management decisions or (2) establishments (except government establishments) that administer, oversee, and manage establishments of the company or enterprise and that normally undertake the strategic or organizational planning and decision-making role of the company or enterprise. Establishments that administer, oversee, and manage may hold the securities of the company or enterprise.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=55&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 55}.. The assembling of component parts of manufactured products is considered manufacturing, except in cases where the activity is appropriately classified in Sector 23, Construction.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=31&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 31-33}.. Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extra.long_description: Count of new jobs created by active businesses (an active business is a company that exist last year) in Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction industry. The Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction sector comprises establishments that extract naturally occurring mineral solids, such as coal and ores; liquid minerals, such as crude petroleum; and gases, such as natural gas. The term mining is used in the broad sense to include quarrying, well operations, beneficiating (e.g., crushing, screening, washing, and flotation), and other preparation customarily performed at the mine site, or as a part of mining activity.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=21&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 21}.. The Real Estate and Rental and Leasing sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in renting, leasing, or otherwise allowing the use of tangible or intangible assets, and establishments providing related services. The major portion of this sector comprises establishments that rent, lease, or otherwise allow the use of their own assets by others.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=53&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 53}.. Transportation and Warehousing_job_creat.long_description: Count of new jobs created by active businesses (an active business is a company that exist last year) in Transportation and Warehousing industry. The Transportation and Warehousing sector includes industries providing transportation of passengers and cargo, warehousing and storage for goods, scenic and sightseeing transportation, and support activities related to modes of transportation. Establishments in these industries use transportation equipment or transportation related facilities as a productive asset. The type of equipment depends on the mode of transportation. The modes of transportation are air, rail, water, road, and pipeline.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=48&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 48-49}.. Available for US businesses.

Utilities_job_creation_active.long_description: Count of new jobs created by active businesses (an active business is a company that exist last year) in Utilities industry. The Utilities sector comprises establishments engaged in the provision of the following utility services: electric power, natural gas, steam supply, water supply, and sewage removal. Within this sector, the specific activities associated with the utility services provided vary by utility: electric power includes generation, transmission, and distribution; natural gas includes distribution; steam supply includes provision and/or distribution; water supply includes treatment and distribution; and sewage removal includes collection, treatment, and disposal of waste through sewer systems and sewage treatment facilities.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=22&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 22}.. Available for US businesses.

The merchandise described in this sector includes the outputs of agriculture, mining, manufacturing, and certain information industries, such as publishing.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=42&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 42}.. The term mining is used in the broad sense to include quarrying, well operations, beneficiating (e.g., crushing, screening, washing, and flotation), and other preparation customarily performed at the mine site, or as a part of mining activity.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=21&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 21}.. Available for US businesses.

The Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services sector comprises establishments that specialize in performing professional, scientific, and technical activities for others. These activities require a high degree of expertise and training.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=54&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 54}.. Available for US businesses.

The Public Administration sector consists of establishments of federal, state, and local government agencies that administer, oversee, and manage public programs and have executive, legislative, or judicial authority over other institutions within a given area.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=92&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 92}.. Real Estate and Rental and Leasing_job_c.long_description: Count of new jobs created by new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region) in Real Estate and Rental and Leasing industry. The Real Estate and Rental and Leasing sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in renting, leasing, or otherwise allowing the use of tangible or intangible assets, and establishments providing related services. The major portion of this sector comprises establishments that rent, lease, or otherwise allow the use of their own assets by others.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=53&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 53}.. Available for US businesses.

Retail Trade_job_creation_new.long_description: Count of new jobs created by new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region) in Retail Trade industry. The Retail Trade sector comprises establishments engaged in retailing merchandise, generally without transformation, and rendering services incidental to the sale of merchandise.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=44&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 44-45}.. Transportation and Warehousing_job_creat.long_description: Count of new jobs created by new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region) in Transportation and Warehousing industry. The Transportation and Warehousing sector includes industries providing transportation of passengers and cargo, warehousing and storage for goods, scenic and sightseeing transportation, and support activities related to modes of transportation. Establishments in these industries use transportation equipment or transportation related facilities as a productive asset. The type of equipment depends on the mode of transportation. The modes of transportation are air, rail, water, road, and pipeline.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=48&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 48-49}.. Available for US businesses.

Utilities_job_creation_new.long_description: Count of new jobs created by new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region) in Utilities industry. The Utilities sector comprises establishments engaged in the provision of the following utility services: electric power, natural gas, steam supply, water supply, and sewage removal. Within this sector, the specific activities associated with the utility services provided vary by utility: electric power includes generation, transmission, and distribution; natural gas includes distribution; steam supply includes provision and/or distribution; water supply includes treatment and distribution; and sewage removal includes collection, treatment, and disposal of waste through sewer systems and sewage treatment facilities.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=22&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 22}.. Available for US businesses.

Wholesale Trade_job_creation_new.long_description: Count of new jobs created by new businesses (a new business is a company newly created or has moved to the region) in Wholesale Trade industry. The Wholesale Trade sector comprises establishments engaged in wholesaling merchandise, generally without transformation, and rendering services incidental to the sale of merchandise. The merchandise described in this sector includes the outputs of agriculture, mining, manufacturing, and certain information industries, such as publishing.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=42&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 42}.. Available for US businesses.

The Accommodation and Food Services sector comprises establishments providing customers with lodging and/or preparing meals, snacks, and beverages for immediate consumption. The sector includes both accommodation and food services establishments because the two activities are often combined at the same establishment.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=72&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 72}.. The Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services sector comprises establishments performing routine support activities for the day-to-day operations of other organizations. These essential activities are often undertaken in-house by establishments in many sectors of the economy.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=56&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 56}.. The Construction sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in the construction of buildings or engineering projects (e.g., highways and utility systems). Establishments primarily engaged in the preparation of sites for new construction and establishments primarily engaged in subdividing land for sale as building sites also are included in this sector.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=23&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 23}.. Educational Services_perc_job_creation_a.long_description: Percent of new jobs created by active businesses (an active business is a company that exist last year): \[perc\_job\_creation\_active=\frac{job\_created\_by\_active\_businesses}{all\_jobs\_created}\] in Educational Services industry. The Educational Services sector comprises establishments that provide instruction and training in a wide variety of subjects. This instruction and training is provided by specialized establishments, such as schools, colleges, universities, and training centers. These establishments may be privately owned and operated for profit or not for profit, or they may be publicly owned and operated. They may also offer food and/or accommodation services to their students.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=61&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 61}.. Available for US businesses.

Management of Companies and Enterprises_.long_description: Percent of new jobs created by active businesses (an active business is a company that exist last year): \[perc\_job\_creation\_active=\frac{job\_created\_by\_active\_businesses}{all\_jobs\_created}\] in Management of Companies and Enterprises industry. The Management of Companies and Enterprises sector comprises (1) establishments that hold the securities of (or other equity interests in) companies and enterprises for the purpose of owning a controlling interest or influencing management decisions or (2) establishments (except government establishments) that administer, oversee, and manage establishments of the company or enterprise and that normally undertake the strategic or organizational planning and decision-making role of the company or enterprise. Establishments that administer, oversee, and manage may hold the securities of the company or enterprise.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=55&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 55}.. The Utilities sector comprises establishments engaged in the provision of the following utility services: electric power, natural gas, steam supply, water supply, and sewage removal. Within this sector, the specific activities associated with the utility services provided vary by utility: electric power includes generation, transmission, and distribution; natural gas includes distribution; steam supply includes provision and/or distribution; water supply includes treatment and distribution; and sewage removal includes collection, treatment, and disposal of waste through sewer systems and sewage treatment facilities.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=22&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 22}.. The Educational Services sector comprises establishments that provide instruction and training in a wide variety of subjects. The Management of Companies and Enterprises sector comprises (1) establishments that hold the securities of (or other equity interests in) companies and enterprises for the purpose of owning a controlling interest or influencing management decisions or (2) establishments (except government establishments) that administer, oversee, and manage establishments of the company or enterprise and that normally undertake the strategic or organizational planning and decision-making role of the company or enterprise. The assembling of component parts of manufactured products is considered manufacturing, except in cases where the activity is appropriately classified in Sector 23, Construction.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=31&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 31-33}.. The Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction sector comprises establishments that extract naturally occurring mineral solids, such as coal and ores; liquid minerals, such as crude petroleum; and gases, such as natural gas. The term mining is used in the broad sense to include quarrying, well operations, beneficiating (e.g., crushing, screening, washing, and flotation), and other preparation customarily performed at the mine site, or as a part of mining activity.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=21&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 21}.. Construction_job_destruction_active.long_description: Count of jobs cutted by active businesses (an active business is a company that exist last year) in Construction industry. Educational Services_job_destruction_act.long_description: Count of jobs cutted by active businesses (an active business is a company that exist last year) in Educational Services industry. The Educational Services sector comprises establishments that provide instruction and training in a wide variety of subjects. This instruction and training is provided by specialized establishments, such as schools, colleges, universities, and training centers. These establishments may be privately owned and operated for profit or not for profit, or they may be publicly owned and operated. Management of Companies and Enterprises_.long_description: Count of jobs cutted by active businesses (an active business is a company that exist last year) in Management of Companies and Enterprises industry. The Management of Companies and Enterprises sector comprises (1) establishments that hold the securities of (or other equity interests in) companies and enterprises for the purpose of owning a controlling interest or influencing management decisions or (2) establishments (except government establishments) that administer, oversee, and manage establishments of the company or enterprise and that normally undertake the strategic or organizational planning and decision-making role of the company or enterprise. Establishments that administer, oversee, and manage may hold the securities of the company or enterprise.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=55&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 55}.. Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extra.long_description: Count of jobs cutted by active businesses (an active business is a company that exist last year) in Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction industry. The Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction sector comprises establishments that extract naturally occurring mineral solids, such as coal and ores; liquid minerals, such as crude petroleum; and gases, such as natural gas. The term mining is used in the broad sense to include quarrying, well operations, beneficiating (e.g., crushing, screening, washing, and flotation), and other preparation customarily performed at the mine site, or as a part of mining activity.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=21&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 21}.. Transportation and Warehousing_job_destr.long_description: Count of jobs cutted by active businesses (an active business is a company that exist last year) in Transportation and Warehousing industry. The Transportation and Warehousing sector includes industries providing transportation of passengers and cargo, warehousing and storage for goods, scenic and sightseeing transportation, and support activities related to modes of transportation. Establishments in these industries use transportation equipment or transportation related facilities as a productive asset. The type of equipment depends on the mode of transportation. The modes of transportation are air, rail, water, road, and pipeline.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=48&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 48-49}.. Available for US businesses.

Utilities_job_destruction_active.long_description: Count of jobs cutted by active businesses (an active business is a company that exist last year) in Utilities industry. The Utilities sector comprises establishments engaged in the provision of the following utility services: electric power, natural gas, steam supply, water supply, and sewage removal. Within this sector, the specific activities associated with the utility services provided vary by utility: electric power includes generation, transmission, and distribution; natural gas includes distribution; steam supply includes provision and/or distribution; water supply includes treatment and distribution; and sewage removal includes collection, treatment, and disposal of waste through sewer systems and sewage treatment facilities.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=22&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 22}.. Available for US businesses.

The merchandise described in this sector includes the outputs of agriculture, mining, manufacturing, and certain information industries, such as publishing.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=42&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 42}.. Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extra.long_description: Count of jobs cutted by closed businesses (a closed business is a company that stoped its activities or leaving the region) in Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction industry. The Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction sector comprises establishments that extract naturally occurring mineral solids, such as coal and ores; liquid minerals, such as crude petroleum; and gases, such as natural gas. The term mining is used in the broad sense to include quarrying, well operations, beneficiating (e.g., crushing, screening, washing, and flotation), and other preparation customarily performed at the mine site, or as a part of mining activity.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=21&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 21}.. Available for US businesses.

These activities require a high degree of expertise and training.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=54&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 54}.. Available for US businesses.

Public Administration_job_destruction_ex.long_description: Count of jobs cutted by closed businesses (a closed business is a company that stoped its activities or leaving the region) in Public Administration industry. The Public Administration sector consists of establishments of federal, state, and local government agencies that administer, oversee, and manage public programs and have executive, legislative, or judicial authority over other institutions within a given area.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=92&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 92}.. Real Estate and Rental and Leasing_job_d.long_description: Count of jobs cutted by closed businesses (a closed business is a company that stoped its activities or leaving the region) in Real Estate and Rental and Leasing industry. The Real Estate and Rental and Leasing sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in renting, leasing, or otherwise allowing the use of tangible or intangible assets, and establishments providing related services. The major portion of this sector comprises establishments that rent, lease, or otherwise allow the use of their own assets by others.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=53&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 53}.. Available for US businesses.

The Retail Trade sector comprises establishments engaged in retailing merchandise, generally without transformation, and rendering services incidental to the sale of merchandise.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=44&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 44-45}.. Transportation and Warehousing_job_destr.long_description: Count of jobs cutted by closed businesses (a closed business is a company that stoped its activities or leaving the region) in Transportation and Warehousing industry. The Transportation and Warehousing sector includes industries providing transportation of passengers and cargo, warehousing and storage for goods, scenic and sightseeing transportation, and support activities related to modes of transportation. Establishments in these industries use transportation equipment or transportation related facilities as a productive asset. The type of equipment depends on the mode of transportation. The modes of transportation are air, rail, water, road, and pipeline.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=48&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 48-49}.. Available for US businesses.

Utilities_job_destruction_exit.long_description: Count of jobs cutted by closed businesses (a closed business is a company that stoped its activities or leaving the region) in Utilities industry. The Utilities sector comprises establishments engaged in the provision of the following utility services: electric power, natural gas, steam supply, water supply, and sewage removal. Within this sector, the specific activities associated with the utility services provided vary by utility: electric power includes generation, transmission, and distribution; natural gas includes distribution; steam supply includes provision and/or distribution; water supply includes treatment and distribution; and sewage removal includes collection, treatment, and disposal of waste through sewer systems and sewage treatment facilities.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=22&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 22}.. Available for US businesses.

Wholesale Trade_job_destruction_exit.long_description: Count of jobs cutted by closed businesses (a closed business is a company that stoped its activities or leaving the region) in Wholesale Trade industry. The Wholesale Trade sector comprises establishments engaged in wholesaling merchandise, generally without transformation, and rendering services incidental to the sale of merchandise. The merchandise described in this sector includes the outputs of agriculture, mining, manufacturing, and certain information industries, such as publishing.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=42&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 42}.. Available for US businesses.

Accommodation and Food Services_perc_job.long_description: Percent of jobs cutted by active businesses (an active business is a company that exist last year): \[perc\_job\_destruction\_active=\frac{jobs\_eliminated\_by\_active\_businesses}{all\_jobs\_eliminated}\] in Accommodation and Food Services industry. The Accommodation and Food Services sector comprises establishments providing customers with lodging and/or preparing meals, snacks, and beverages for immediate consumption. The sector includes both accommodation and food services establishments because the two activities are often combined at the same establishment.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=72&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 72}.. Available for US businesses.

The Administrative and Support and Waste Management and Remediation Services sector comprises establishments performing routine support activities for the day-to-day operations of other organizations. These essential activities are often undertaken in-house by establishments in many sectors of the economy.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=56&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 56}.. The Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in growing crops, raising animals, harvesting timber, and harvesting fish and other animals from a farm, ranch, or their natural habitats.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=11&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 11}.. The Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation sector includes a wide range of establishments that operate facilities or provide services to meet varied cultural, entertainment, and recreational interests of their patrons.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=71&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 71}.. The Construction sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in the construction of buildings or engineering projects (e.g., highways and utility systems). Establishments primarily engaged in the preparation of sites for new construction and establishments primarily engaged in subdividing land for sale as building sites also are included in this sector.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=23&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 23}.. Educational Services_perc_job_destructio.long_description: Percent of jobs cutted by active businesses (an active business is a company that exist last year): \[perc\_job\_destruction\_active=\frac{jobs\_eliminated\_by\_active\_businesses}{all\_jobs\_eliminated}\] in Educational Services industry. The Educational Services sector comprises establishments that provide instruction and training in a wide variety of subjects. This instruction and training is provided by specialized establishments, such as schools, colleges, universities, and training centers. These establishments may be privately owned and operated for profit or not for profit, or they may be publicly owned and operated. They may also offer food and/or accommodation services to their students.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=61&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 61}.. Available for US businesses.

The Health Care and Social Assistance sector comprises establishments providing health care and social assistance for individuals. The sector includes both health care and social assistance because it is sometimes difficult to distinguish between the boundaries of these two activities.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=62&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 62}.. The Information sector comprises establishments engaged in the following processes: (a) producing and distributing information and cultural products, (b) providing the means to transmit or distribute these products as well as data or communications, and (c) processing data.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=51&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 51}.. The Management of Companies and Enterprises sector comprises (1) establishments that hold the securities of (or other equity interests in) companies and enterprises for the purpose of owning a controlling interest or influencing management decisions or (2) establishments (except government establishments) that administer, oversee, and manage establishments of the company or enterprise and that normally undertake the strategic or organizational planning and decision-making role of the company or enterprise. Establishments that administer, oversee, and manage may hold the securities of the company or enterprise.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=55&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 55}.. The Transportation and Warehousing sector includes industries providing transportation of passengers and cargo, warehousing and storage for goods, scenic and sightseeing transportation, and support activities related to modes of transportation. Establishments in these industries use transportation equipment or transportation related facilities as a productive asset. The type of equipment depends on the mode of transportation. The modes of transportation are air, rail, water, road, and pipeline.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=48&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 48-49}.. Available for US businesses.

The Utilities sector comprises establishments engaged in the provision of the following utility services: electric power, natural gas, steam supply, water supply, and sewage removal. Within this sector, the specific activities associated with the utility services provided vary by utility: electric power includes generation, transmission, and distribution; natural gas includes distribution; steam supply includes provision and/or distribution; water supply includes treatment and distribution; and sewage removal includes collection, treatment, and disposal of waste through sewer systems and sewage treatment facilities.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=22&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 22}.. Construction_total_job_destruction.long_description: Total jobs cutted by businesses in Construction industry. The Construction sector comprises establishments primarily engaged in the construction of buildings or engineering projects (e.g., highways and utility systems). Establishments primarily engaged in the preparation of sites for new construction and establishments primarily engaged in subdividing land for sale as building sites also are included in this sector.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=23&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 23}.. Educational Services_total_job_destructi.long_description: Total jobs cutted by businesses in Educational Services industry. The Educational Services sector comprises establishments that provide instruction and training in a wide variety of subjects. This instruction and training is provided by specialized establishments, such as schools, colleges, universities, and training centers. These establishments may be privately owned and operated for profit or not for profit, or they may be publicly owned and operated. They may also offer food and/or accommodation services to their students.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=61&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 61}.. Available for US businesses.

Management of Companies and Enterprises_.long_description: Total jobs cutted by businesses in Management of Companies and Enterprises industry. The Management of Companies and Enterprises sector comprises (1) establishments that hold the securities of (or other equity interests in) companies and enterprises for the purpose of owning a controlling interest or influencing management decisions or (2) establishments (except government establishments) that administer, oversee, and manage establishments of the company or enterprise and that normally undertake the strategic or organizational planning and decision-making role of the company or enterprise. Establishments that administer, oversee, and manage may hold the securities of the company or enterprise.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=55&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 55}.. The assembling of component parts of manufactured products is considered manufacturing, except in cases where the activity is appropriately classified in Sector 23, Construction.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=31&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 31-33}.. Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extra.long_description: Total jobs cutted by businesses in Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction industry. The Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction sector comprises establishments that extract naturally occurring mineral solids, such as coal and ores; liquid minerals, such as crude petroleum; and gases, such as natural gas. The term mining is used in the broad sense to include quarrying, well operations, beneficiating (e.g., crushing, screening, washing, and flotation), and other preparation customarily performed at the mine site, or as a part of mining activity.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=21&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 21}.. Transportation and Warehousing_total_job.long_description: Total jobs cutted by businesses in Transportation and Warehousing industry. The Transportation and Warehousing sector includes industries providing transportation of passengers and cargo, warehousing and storage for goods, scenic and sightseeing transportation, and support activities related to modes of transportation. Establishments in these industries use transportation equipment or transportation related facilities as a productive asset. The type of equipment depends on the mode of transportation. The modes of transportation are air, rail, water, road, and pipeline.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=48&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 48-49}.. Available for US businesses.

Utilities_total_job_destruction.long_description: Total jobs cutted by businesses in Utilities industry. The Utilities sector comprises establishments engaged in the provision of the following utility services: electric power, natural gas, steam supply, water supply, and sewage removal. Within this sector, the specific activities associated with the utility services provided vary by utility: electric power includes generation, transmission, and distribution; natural gas includes distribution; steam supply includes provision and/or distribution; water supply includes treatment and distribution; and sewage removal includes collection, treatment, and disposal of waste through sewer systems and sewage treatment facilities.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=22&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 22}.. Available for US businesses.

The merchandise described in this sector includes the outputs of agriculture, mining, manufacturing, and certain information industries, such as publishing.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=42&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 42}.. Transportation and Warehousing_Location_.long_description: Ratio of industry employment share from an area relative to the county: \[Location\_quotient=\frac{industry\_employment\_share_geography}{industry\_employment\_share_county}\] in Transportation and Warehousing industry. The Transportation and Warehousing sector includes industries providing transportation of passengers and cargo, warehousing and storage for goods, scenic and sightseeing transportation, and support activities related to modes of transportation. Establishments in these industries use transportation equipment or transportation related facilities as a productive asset. The type of equipment depends on the mode of transportation. The modes of transportation are air, rail, water, road, and pipeline.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=48&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 48-49}.. Available for US businesses.

Utilities_Location_quotient.long_description: Ratio of industry employment share from an area relative to the county: \[Location\_quotient=\frac{industry\_employment\_share_geography}{industry\_employment\_share_county}\] in Utilities industry. The Utilities sector comprises establishments engaged in the provision of the following utility services: electric power, natural gas, steam supply, water supply, and sewage removal. Within this sector, the specific activities associated with the utility services provided vary by utility: electric power includes generation, transmission, and distribution; natural gas includes distribution; steam supply includes provision and/or distribution; water supply includes treatment and distribution; and sewage removal includes collection, treatment, and disposal of waste through sewer systems and sewage treatment facilities.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=22&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 22}.. Available for US businesses.

Wholesale Trade_Location_quotient.long_description: Ratio of industry employment share from an area relative to the county: \[Location\_quotient=\frac{industry\_employment\_share_geography}{industry\_employment\_share_county}\] in Wholesale Trade industry. The Wholesale Trade sector comprises establishments engaged in wholesaling merchandise, generally without transformation, and rendering services incidental to the sale of merchandise. The merchandise described in this sector includes the outputs of agriculture, mining, manufacturing, and certain information industries, such as publishing.\href{https://www.census.gov/naics/?input=42&chart=2022}{NAICS code: 42}.. The Management of Companies and Enterprises sector comprises (1) establishments that hold the securities of (or other equity interests in) companies and enterprises for the purpose of owning a controlling interest or influencing management decisions or (2) establishments (except government establishments) that administer, oversee, and manage establishments of the company or enterprise and that normally undertake the strategic or organizational planning and decision-making role of the company or enterprise.
